context.description:
This operator acts as a RabbitMQ consumer, pulling messages from a RabbitMQ broker. The broker is assumed to be already configured and running. The outgoing stream can have three attributes: message, routing_key, and messageHeader. The message is a required attribute. The exchange name, queue name, and routing key can be specified using parameters. If a specified exchange does not exist, it will be created as a non-durable exchange. If a queue name is specified for a queue that already exists, all binding parameters (exchangeName and routing_key) will be ignored. Only queues created by this operator will result in exchange/routing key bindings. All exchanges and queues created by this operator are non-durable and auto-delete.This operator supports direct, fanout, and topic exchanges. It does not support header exchanges.
**Behavior in a Consistent Region** This operator cannot participate in a consistent region.

parameter.name: automaticRecovery
parameter.description: Have connections to RabbitMQ automatically recovered. Default is true.

parameter.name: exchangeName
parameter.description: Name of the RabbitMQ exchange to bind the queue to. If consuming from an already existing queue, this parameter is ignored. To use default RabbitMQ exchange, do not specify this parameter or use empty quotes: "".

parameter.name: exchangeType
parameter.description: Optional attribute. Name of the RabbitMQ exchange type. Default direct.

parameter.name: hostAndPort
parameter.description: List of host and port in form: "myhost1:3456","myhost2:3456".

parameter.name: messageAttribute
parameter.description: Name of the attribute for the message. Default is "message".

parameter.name: msgHeaderAttribute
parameter.description: Name of the attribute for the message_header. Schema of type must be Map<ustring,ustring>. Default is "message_header".

parameter.name: queueName
parameter.description: Name of the queue. Main reason to specify is to facilitate parallel consuming. If this parameter is not specified, a queue will be created using a randomly generated name.

parameter.name: routingKey
parameter.description: Routing key/keys to bind the queue to. If you are connecting to an existing queue, these bindings will be ignored.

parameter.name: routingKeyAttribute
parameter.description: Name of the attribute for the routing_key. Default is "routing_key".

parameter.name: virtualHost
parameter.description: Set Virtual Host. Default is null.

outputPortSet.description: Messages received from Kafka are sent on this output port.
